title: Yoruba Watch Faces
summary: Watch Faces in the Yoruba Language. Illustrations by @TheVunderkind.
description: Yorùbá Watch Faces is a collection of Watch Faces built in a popular local Nigerian dialect; the Yorùbá Language. There are currently two Watch Faces in the collection.The illustrations were created by @TheVunderkind and they depict a man and a woman dressed in the traditional Yorùbá attire. The tone-marked letters were gotten from YorubaName.com.The Watch Faces work on all screen types; chin, square and circle.PLEASE NOTE: Yorùbá Watch Faces now works on smart phones. You can choose to view the time on your Android phone through the home screen widget or through the application itself.
descriptionHTML:
Yorùbá Watch Faces is a collection of Watch Faces built in a popular local Nigerian dialect; the Yorùbá Language. There are currently two Watch Faces in the collection.

The illustrations were created by @TheVunderkind and they depict a man and a woman dressed in the traditional Yorùbá attire. The tone-marked letters were gotten from YorubaName.com.

The Watch Faces work on all screen types; chin, square and circle.

PLEASE NOTE: Yorùbá Watch Faces now works on smart phones. You can choose to view the time on your Android phone through the home screen widget or through the application itself.
comments: Innovative! This is a commendable effort. There is no app like it in Yoruba language, so it is innovative. It can be of great help to those who read only Yoruba, a learning tool for those who want to learn the language, and a useful app for comparative language study.
Glitches Hi Moyin, ìséjú is missing the S and the app doesn't state the minutes (fún àpeere: "aago méjo ku ì éjú" dípò "méjo ku ìséjú méwàá") on my phone.
Add voice Great job. I think you should add voice capabilities also. It should tell me the time in yoruba when i tap a button
Great Job @moyin.  Will love to work with you.  Great IFE spirit!
recentChanges: You can now view the time in Yoruba from your Android phones, yaaay!
You can do this with the home screen widget if you don't want to keep opening the application every time you need to check the time.
We know how much you love to make your app yours so we also built a customizable mobile application for you to view the time in Yoruba too.
